skill.name: objective-cycle
skill.desc: Creating and iterating on objective files for task planning
skill.tools: - `META/objectives/` directory - `date +"%Y%m%d-%H%M"` for timestamps - TodoWrite/TodoRead tools for execution tracking
skill.file_format:
```markdown # OBJECTIVE Single sentence describing the goal.
Brief context paragraph explaining background and motivation.
# CODE SNIPPETS Suggested implementation patterns with syntax highlighting.
# IMPORTANT NOTES - Architectural constraints - Dependencies to preserve - Performance considerations
# TASK LIST - [ ] Phase 1: Foundation - [ ] Specific actionable task with `main/file/path.rs` - [ ] Another task - [ ] Phase 2: Implementation - [ ] ... ```
skill.steps: 1. Get timestamp: `date +"%Y%m%d-%H%M"` 2. Create file: `META/objectives/YYYYMMDD-HHMM-description.md` 3. Write objective with: - Clear single-sentence goal - Context paragraph - Code snippets (if applicable) - Important notes with constraints - Hierarchical task list with file paths 4. Present to user for review and iteration 5. Once approved, copy tasks to TodoWrite tool 6. Execute tasks, marking complete as you go 7. Run tests after code changes 8. Send completion notification: `notify-send "Objective" "Work Completed"`
skill.task_rules: - Tasks must be actionable (can be checked off when done) - Include exact file paths in backticks (relative to project root) - Use action verbs: Create, Update, Implement, Test - Include unit test tasks for all code changes - Non-actionable info goes in Important Notes, not tasks - Always end with completion notification task
skill.objectives_vs_tickets:
- **Objectives**: Planning documents for exploration, design, broad work - **Tickets**: Claimable work units bound to a feature branch and worktree
Use objectives for planning and iteration with the user. Use tickets when work is well-defined and ready to be claimed and executed in isolation.
